page.title: 04EDUCATION - NORTH TAWTON
page.content: The very first school to appear in North Tawton was established in 1870. The higher classroom and middle classroom were destroyed by a fire which occurred on the night 28th February 1929. It was rebuilt slightly smaller soon afterwards. There was also a school in Essington which dated between 1867-1895. It was a boys' school and the premises were in use under the name of the{Middle Class {School. The present{Primary School}was built in 1938 as a secondary modern school. It changed from a secondary school into a{Primary}in 1962 when {Comprehensive Education}was introduced in the Okehampton area. At presant there are 130 children in the school which is split into five classes.There is a thriving{Playgroup.
